intro: Cotylonychia, commonly known as the "false ginseng," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic, often hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as woodlands and stream banks. Cotylonychia species have small, yellowish flowers and produce berries that contain the seeds. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the carrot family, with some species used in traditional medicine.
